message_1: Given the algebraic surface defined by the equation x^3 + y^3 + z^3 = 6xyz, find the equation of the tangent plane to the surface at the point (1,1,2).
message_2:
To find the equation of the tangent plane to the surface at the point (1,1,2), we first need to find the gradient of the surface at that point. The gradient is given by the partial derivatives with respect to x, y, and z.

Let F(x, y, z) = x^3 + y^3 + z^3 - 6xyz.

Compute the partial derivatives:
∂F/∂x = 3x^2 - 6yz
∂F/∂y = 3y^2 - 6xz
∂F/∂z = 3z^2 - 6xy

Now, evaluate the partial derivatives at the point (1,1,2):
∂F/∂x(1,1,2) = 3(1)^2 - 6(1)(2) = 3 - 12 = -9
∂F/∂y(1,1,2) = 3(1)^2 - 6(1)(1) = 3 - 6 = -3
∂F/∂z(1,1,2) = 3(2)^2 - 6(1)(1) = 12 - 6 = 6

The gradient of F at the point (1,1,2) is given by the vector <-9, -3, 6>.

Now, we can find the equation of the tangent plane using the point-slope form:
F(x, y, z) - F(1, 1, 2) = <-9, -3, 6> • <x - 1, y - 1, z - 2>

Plug in F(1, 1, 2) = 1^3 + 1^3 + 2^3 - 6(1)(1)(2) = 1 + 1 + 8 - 12 = -2:

(x^3 + y^3 + z^3 - 6xyz) - (-2) = -9(x - 1) - 3(y - 1) + 6(z - 2)

Simplify the equation:

x^3 + y^3 + z^3 - 6xyz + 2 = -9x + 9 - 3y + 3 + 6z - 12

x^3 + y^3 + z^3 - 6xyz = -9x - 3y + 6z + 8

This is the equation of the tangent plane to the surface at the point (1,1,2).
